fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Note that the category {{({{\mathcal {C}}_{/{B}}})}_{/{f}}} consists of the following data:
Thus, we may take \Sigma _{f} to be the forgetful functor {{({{\mathcal {C}}_{/{B}}})}_{/{f}}} \to {{\mathcal {C}}_{/{A}}}.

Let \mathcal {C} be an arbitrary category and f\colon A\to B be a morphism. There is a faithful functor \Sigma _{f}\colon {{\mathcal {C}}_{/{A}}}\to {{\mathcal {C}}_{/{B}}} whose action on objects is the assignment g \mapsto fg.
Note that the category {{({{\mathcal {C}}_{/{B}}})}_{/{f}}} consists of the following data:
Thus, we may take \Sigma _{f} to be the forgetful functor {{({{\mathcal {C}}_{/{B}}})}_{/{f}}} \to {{\mathcal {C}}_{/{A}}}.
